update.description:
Adds widgets for some message types which receive special treatment. For example, a pose widget is displayed as a single property instead of nested `pose -> position -> x` and so on. These messages are placed in a collapsible if they're nested into other widgets, or placed directly on the top level if that's the whole message. Examples can be tested on `topicInterface.config`:

### Top level Vector3d message with presets

![toplvlvec.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3684161561-toplvlvec.gif)

### Top level pose message

![toplvlpose.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3197814502-toplvlpose.gif)

### Nested color message with custom dialog

![nestedcolor.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2864832133-nestedcolor.gif)
update.title: Widgets from messages (part 3)

content.html: @nkoenig , I also addressed the issue with updating the preset even before the widget loses focus on 9a01b07

content.html: Done 9a01b07

update.description:
Adds widgets for some message types which receive special treatment. For example, a pose widget is displayed as a single property instead of nested `pose -> position -> x` and so on. These messages are placed in a collapsible if they're nested into other widgets, or placed directly on the top level if that's the whole message. Examples can be tested on `topicInterface.config`:

### Top level Vector3d message with presets

![toplvlvec.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3684161561-toplvlvec.gif)

### Top level pose message

![toplvlpose.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3197814502-toplvlpose.gif)

update.title: Widgets from messages (part 3)

content.raw:
One thing done across all widgets is that the tooltip shows the name of the field in the message. For example, a field called `cast_shadows` will have a label `Cast shadows` and a tooltip `cast_shadows`. Not all widgets maintain the fields from the message though, pose for example displays "Roll" "Pitch" Yaw" instead of "x" "y" "z" "w".

But I agree, let's go with a nice tooltip since the way this widget is implemented, it could be used outside of the context of a protobuf message.
content.html:
One thing done across all widgets is that the tooltip shows the name of the field in the message. For example, a field called cast_shadows will have a label Cast shadows and a tooltip cast_shadows. Not all widgets maintain the fields from the message though, pose for example displays "Roll" "Pitch" Yaw" instead of "x" "y" "z" "w".

But I agree, let's go with a nice tooltip since the way this widget is implemented, it could be used outside of the context of a protobuf message.

content.raw: The tool tip would help. I think you could also spell out "Unit X" in each item
content.html: The tool tip would help. I think you could also spell out "Unit X" in each item

content.raw: Do you think a tooltip for the whole combo box would do the trick? Something like "Unit vector presets"
content.html: Do you think a tooltip for the whole combo box would do the trick? Something like "Unit vector presets"

content.raw: These items were confusing to me, until I looked at the UpdatePreset code. Is it possible to clarify to the user that these are Unit vector presets?
content.html: These items were confusing to me, until I looked at the UpdatePreset code. Is it possible to clarify to the user that these are Unit vector presets?

content.raw: Should the tool tip spell out "red", "green", etc?
content.html: Should the tool tip spell out "red", "green", etc?
